title: Rotational inertia - minimum I for M0-3M0 system

content.description: Two small spheres are connected by a rod of negligible mass, as shown in the figure. The sphere on the left has mass <math alttext="M sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, the sphere on the right has mass <math alttext="3 M sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, and the spheres’ centers are a distance <math alttext="L sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> apart. The two-sphere system’s rotational inertia about an axis perpendicular to the page that passes through the center of the sphere on the left is <math alttext="I sub L" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>L</mi></msub></math>. The minimum rotational inertia of the two-sphere system about an axis perpendicular to the page is <math alttext="I sub minimum" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>I</mi> <mi>min</mi> </msub> </math>.
